title: Select All Users
markdown:
# **Select All Users**

**Difficulty:** Easy  •  **Tags:** `SELECT`



## **Problem Description**

Write a SQL query to select all columns from the `users` table.



## **Table Schema**

**users**
```
+--------+------+
| Column | Type |
+--------+------+
| id     | INT  |
| name   | TEXT |
| age    | INT  |
+--------+------+
```



## **Example**

### **Input**

**users**
```
+----+---------+-----+
| id | name    | age |
+----+---------+-----+
| 1  | Alice   | 30  |
| 2  | Bob     | 25  |
| 3  | Charlie | 35  |
+----+---------+-----+
```

### **Expected Output**

```
+----+---------+-----+
| id | name    | age |
+----+---------+-----+
| 1  | Alice   | 30  |
| 2  | Bob     | 25  |
| 3  | Charlie | 35  |
+----+---------+-----+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE users(id INT, name TEXT, age INT); INSERT INTO users VALUES (1,'Alice',30),(2,'Bob',25),(3,'Charlie',35);
CREATE TABLE users(id INT, name TEXT, age INT);
CREATE TABLE users(id INT, name TEXT, age INT); INSERT INTO users VALUES (1,'Alice',30),(2,'Bob',25),(3,'Charlie',35);
